wikipedia_page.main: Perry Digweed (born 26 October 1959) is an English former professional footballer who played as a goalkeeper for Fulham, Brighton & Hove Albion, Chelsea, Wimbledon and Watford, making 226 appearances in the Football League.After retiring from football, Digweed went on to appear alongside Vinnie Jones in the film Mean Machine.

response: Meola had signed with the U.S. Soccer Federation before the 1990 FIFA World Cup.  Following the cup, Meola signed on loan with English second division club Brighton & Hove Albion where he played eleven games; only two were league games.  He gained his first start when he replaced the injured Perry Digweed and promptly won man of the match honors.May 6, 2002 profile in The Argus  On September 14, 1990, Meola was transferred to second division club Watford before moving back to the U.S.,New York Times  which he did when he was unable to renew his work permit due to his inability to gain first team time with Watford.New York Times

The film included actors who had formerly played professional football, including three players who were teammates with the film's star, Vinnie Jones, at different times in their careers. Charlie Hartfield (prisoners' team in the film) played with Jones for Sheffield United, while Paul Fishenden and Brian Gayle (guards' team in the film) played with Jones for Wimbledon. Nevin Saroya (prisoners' team) was once a Brentford youth team player and Perry Digweed (guard's team), played as a goalkeeper primarily for Brighton & Hove Albion, although in the film, he is a defender. Ryan Giggs, then playing for Manchester United and the Wales national football team, appears briefly (at minute 77:00) as a warden.
